p: In another study, the essential oil of Aframomum sceptrum (Oliv. and D. Hanb.) K. Schum. [ 49] presented in vitro anti- T. brucei activity at a concentration of 1.51 µg/mL. Analysis of the essential oils of this species revealed the constituents β-pinene and caryophyllene oxide, to which the trypanocidal activity was attributed.
